property.description: If any of file related block movements not at all reported by datanode, then after this timeout(in milliseconds), the item will be added back to movement needed list at namenode which will be retried for block movements. The default value is 5 * 60 * 1000 (5 mins)

property.name: dfs.storage.policy.satisfier.retry.max.attempts
property.description: Max retry to satisfy the block storage policy. After this retry block will be removed from the movement needed queue.

property.name: dfs.storage.policy.satisfier.move.task.retry.max.attempts
property.description: Max retries for moving task to satisfy the block storage policy.

property.name: dfs.storage.policy.satisfier.datanode.cache.refresh.interval.ms
property.description: How often to refresh the datanode storages cache in milliseconds. This cache keeps live datanode storage reports fetched from namenode. After elapsed time, it will again fetch latest datanodes from namenode. By default, this parameter is set to 5 minutes.

property.name: dfs.storage.policy.satisfier.max.outstanding.paths
property.description: Defines the maximum number of paths to satisfy that can be queued up in the Satisfier call queue in a period of time. Default value is 10000.

property.name: dfs.storage.policy.satisfier.address
property.description: The hostname used for a keytab based Kerberos login. Keytab based login is required when dfs.storage.policy.satisfier.mode is external.

property.name: dfs.storage.policy.satisfier.keytab.file
property.description: The keytab file used by external StoragePolicySatisfier to login as its service principal. The principal name is configured with dfs.storage.policy.satisfier.kerberos.principal. Keytab based login is required when dfs.storage.policy.satisfier.mode is external.

property.name: dfs.storage.policy.satisfier.kerberos.principal
property.description: The StoragePolicySatisfier principal. This is typically set to satisfier/_HOST@REALM.TLD. The StoragePolicySatisfier will substitute _HOST with its own fully qualified hostname at startup. The _HOST placeholder allows using the same configuration setting on different servers. Keytab based login is required when dfs.storage.policy.satisfier.mode is external.

property.name: dfs.pipeline.ecn
property.description: If true, allows ECN (explicit congestion notification) from the Datanode.

property.name: dfs.pipeline.slownode
property.description: If true, allows slownode information to be replied to Client via PipelineAck.

property.name: dfs.pipeline.congestion.ratio
property.description: The ratio which is used to compute congestion load.

property.name: dfs.qjournal.accept-recovery.timeout.ms
property.description: Quorum timeout in milliseconds during accept phase of recovery/synchronization for a specific segment.

property.name: dfs.qjournal.finalize-segment.timeout.ms
property.description: Quorum timeout in milliseconds during finalizing for a specific segment.

property.name: dfs.qjournal.get-journal-state.timeout.ms
property.description: Timeout in milliseconds when calling getJournalState(). JournalNodes.

property.name: dfs.qjournal.new-epoch.timeout.ms
property.description: Timeout in milliseconds when getting an epoch number for write access to JournalNodes.

property.name: dfs.qjournal.prepare-recovery.timeout.ms
property.description: Quorum timeout in milliseconds during preparation phase of recovery/synchronization for a specific segment.

property.name: dfs.qjournal.queued-edits.limit.mb
property.description: Queue size in MB for quorum journal edits.

property.name: dfs.qjournal.select-input-streams.timeout.ms
property.description: Timeout in milliseconds for accepting streams from JournalManagers.

property.name: dfs.qjournal.start-segment.timeout.ms
property.description: Quorum timeout in milliseconds for starting a log segment.

property.name: dfs.qjournal.write-txns.timeout.ms
property.description: Write timeout in milliseconds when writing to a quorum of remote journals.

property.name: dfs.qjournal.http.open.timeout.ms
property.description: Timeout in milliseconds when open a new HTTP connection to remote journals.

property.name: dfs.qjournal.http.read.timeout.ms
property.description: Timeout in milliseconds when reading from a HTTP connection from remote journals.

property.name: dfs.qjournal.parallel-read.num-threads
property.description: Number of threads per JN to be used for tailing edits.

property.name: dfs.quota.by.storage.type.enabled
property.description: If true, enables quotas based on storage type.

property.name: dfs.secondary.namenode.kerberos.principal
property.description: Kerberos principal name for the Secondary NameNode.

property.name: dfs.secondary.namenode.keytab.file
property.description: Kerberos keytab file for the Secondary NameNode.

property.name: dfs.web.authentication.simple.anonymous.allowed
property.description: If true, allow anonymous user to access WebHDFS. Set to false to disable anonymous authentication.

property.name: dfs.web.ugi
property.description: dfs.web.ugi is deprecated. Use hadoop.http.staticuser.user instead.

property.name: dfs.webhdfs.netty.high.watermark
property.description: High watermark configuration to Netty for Datanode WebHdfs.

property.name: dfs.webhdfs.netty.low.watermark
property.description: Low watermark configuration to Netty for Datanode WebHdfs.

property.name: dfs.webhdfs.oauth2.access.token.provider
property.description: Access token provider class for WebHDFS using OAuth2. Defaults to org.apache.hadoop.hdfs.web.oauth2.ConfCredentialBasedAccessTokenProvider.

property.name: dfs.webhdfs.oauth2.client.id
property.description: Client id used to obtain access token with either credential or refresh token.

property.name: dfs.webhdfs.oauth2.enabled
property.description: If true, enables OAuth2 in WebHDFS

property.name: dfs.webhdfs.oauth2.refresh.url
property.description: URL against which to post for obtaining bearer token with either credential or refresh token.

property.name: ssl.server.keystore.keypassword
property.description: Keystore key password for HTTPS SSL configuration

property.name: ssl.server.keystore.location
property.description: Keystore location for HTTPS SSL configuration

property.name: ssl.server.keystore.password
property.description: Keystore password for HTTPS SSL configuration

property.name: ssl.server.truststore.location
property.description: Truststore location for HTTPS SSL configuration

property.name: ssl.server.truststore.password
property.description: Truststore password for HTTPS SSL configuration

property.name: dfs.disk.balancer.max.disk.throughputInMBperSec
property.description: Maximum disk bandwidth used by diskbalancer during read from a source disk. The unit is MB/sec.

property.name: dfs.disk.balancer.block.tolerance.percent
property.description: When a disk balancer copy operation is proceeding, the datanode is still active. So it might not be possible to move the exactly specified amount of data. So tolerance allows us to define a percentage which defines a good enough move.

property.name: dfs.disk.balancer.max.disk.errors
property.description: During a block move from a source to destination disk, we might encounter various errors. This defines how many errors we can tolerate before we declare a move between 2 disks (or a step) has failed.

property.name: dfs.disk.balancer.plan.valid.interval
property.description: Maximum amount of time disk balancer plan is valid. This setting supports multiple time unit suffixes as described in dfs.heartbeat.interval. If no suffix is specified then milliseconds is assumed.

property.name: dfs.disk.balancer.enabled
property.description: This enables the diskbalancer feature on a cluster. By default, disk balancer is enabled.

property.name: dfs.disk.balancer.plan.threshold.percent
property.description: The percentage threshold value for volume Data Density in a plan. If the absolute value of volume Data Density which is out of threshold value in a node, it means that the volumes corresponding to the disks should do the balancing in the plan. The default value is 10.

property.name: dfs.namenode.provided.enabled
property.description: Enables the Namenode to handle provided storages.

property.name: dfs.provided.storage.id
property.description: The storage ID used for provided stores.

property.name: dfs.provided.aliasmap.class
property.description: The class that is used to specify the input format of the blocks on provided storages. The default is org.apache.hadoop.hdfs.server.common.blockaliasmap.impl.TextFileRegionAliasMap which uses file regions to describe blocks. The file regions are specified as a delimited text file. Each file region is a 6-tuple containing the block id, remote file path, offset into file, length of block, the block pool id containing the block, and the generation stamp of the block.

property.name: dfs.provided.aliasmap.inmemory.batch-size
property.description: The batch size when iterating over the database backing the aliasmap

property.name: dfs.provided.aliasmap.inmemory.dnrpc-address
property.description: The address where the aliasmap server will be running. In the case of HA/Federation where multiple namenodes exist, and if the Namenode is configured to run the aliasmap server (dfs.provided.aliasmap.inmemory.enabled is set to true), the name service id is added to the name, e.g., dfs.provided.aliasmap.inmemory.rpc.address.EXAMPLENAMESERVICE. The value of this property will take the form of host:rpc-port.

property.name: dfs.provided.aliasmap.inmemory.rpc.bind-host
property.description: The actual address the in-memory aliasmap server will bind to. If this optional address is set, it overrides the hostname portion of dfs.provided.aliasmap.inmemory.rpc.address. This is useful for making the name node listen on all interfaces by setting it to 0.0.0.0.

property.name: dfs.provided.aliasmap.inmemory.leveldb.dir
property.description: The directory where the leveldb files will be kept

property.name: dfs.provided.aliasmap.inmemory.enabled
property.description: Don't use the aliasmap by default. Some tests will fail because they try to start the namenode twice with the same parameters if you turn it on.

property.name: dfs.provided.aliasmap.inmemory.server.log
property.description: Ensures that InMemoryAliasMap server logs every call to it. Set to false by default.

property.name: dfs.provided.aliasmap.text.delimiter
property.description: The delimiter used when the provided block map is specified as a text file.

property.name: dfs.provided.aliasmap.text.read.file
property.description: The path specifying the provided block map as a text file, specified as a URI.

property.name: dfs.provided.aliasmap.text.codec
property.description: The codec used to de-compress the provided block map.

property.name: dfs.provided.aliasmap.text.write.dir
property.description: The path to which the provided block map should be written as a text file, specified as a URI.

property.name: dfs.provided.aliasmap.leveldb.path
property.description: The read/write path for the leveldb-based alias map (org.apache.hadoop.hdfs.server.common.blockaliasmap.impl.LevelDBFileRegionAliasMap). The path has to be explicitly configured when this alias map is used.

property.name: dfs.provided.acls.import.enabled
property.description: Set to true to inherit ACLs (Access Control Lists) from remote stores during mount. Disabled by default, i.e., ACLs are not inherited from remote stores. Note had HDFS ACLs have to be enabled (dfs.namenode.acls.enabled must be set to true) for this to take effect.

property.name: dfs.provided.aliasmap.load.retries
property.description: The number of retries on the Datanode to load the provided aliasmap; defaults to 0.

property.name: dfs.lock.suppress.warning.interval
property.description: Instrumentation reporting long critical sections will suppress consecutive warnings within this interval.

property.name: httpfs.buffer.size
property.description: The size buffer to be used when creating or opening httpfs filesystem IO stream.

property.name: dfs.webhdfs.use.ipc.callq
property.description: Enables routing of webhdfs calls through rpc call queue

property.name: dfs.datanode.disk.check.min.gap
property.description: The minimum gap between two successive checks of the same DataNode volume. This setting supports multiple time unit suffixes as described in dfs.heartbeat.interval. If no suffix is specified then milliseconds is assumed.

property.name: dfs.datanode.disk.check.timeout
property.description: Maximum allowed time for a disk check to complete. If the check does not complete within this time interval then the disk is declared as failed. This setting supports multiple time unit suffixes as described in dfs.heartbeat.interval. If no suffix is specified then milliseconds is assumed.

property.name: dfs.use.dfs.network.topology
property.description: Enables DFSNetworkTopology to choose nodes for placing replicas. When enabled, NetworkTopology will be instantiated as class defined in property dfs.net.topology.impl, otherwise NetworkTopology will be instantiated as class defined in property net.topology.impl.

property.name: dfs.net.topology.impl
property.description: The implementation class of NetworkTopology used in HDFS. By default, the class org.apache.hadoop.hdfs.net.DFSNetworkTopology is specified and used in block placement. This property only works when dfs.use.dfs.network.topology is true.

property.name: dfs.qjm.operations.timeout
property.description: Common key to set timeout for related operations in QuorumJournalManager. This setting supports multiple time unit suffixes as described in dfs.heartbeat.interval. If no suffix is specified then milliseconds is assumed.

property.name: dfs.reformat.disabled
property.description: Disable reformat of NameNode. If it's value is set to "true" and metadata directories already exist then attempt to format NameNode will throw NameNodeFormatException.

property.name: dfs.namenode.block.deletion.lock.threshold.ms
property.description: The limit of single time lock holding duration for the block asynchronous deletion thread.

property.name: dfs.namenode.block.deletion.unlock.interval.ms
property.description: The sleep interval for yield lock. When the single time lock holding duration of the block asynchronous deletion thread exceeds limit, sleeping to yield lock.

property.name: dfs.namenode.rpc-address.auxiliary-ports
property.description: A comma separated list of auxiliary ports for the NameNode to listen on. This allows exposing multiple NN addresses to clients. Particularly, it is used to enforce different SASL levels on different ports. Empty list indicates that auxiliary ports are disabled.

property.name: dfs.namenode.send.qop.enabled
property.description: A boolean specifies whether NameNode should encrypt the established QOP and include it in block token. The encrypted QOP will be used by DataNode as target QOP, overwriting DataNode configuration. This ensures DataNode will use exactly the same QOP NameNode and client has already agreed on.

property.name: dfs.encrypt.data.overwrite.downstream.derived.qop
property.description: A boolean specifies whether DN should overwrite the downstream QOP in a write pipeline. This is used in the case where client talks to first DN with a QOP, but inter-DN communication needs to be using a different QOP. If set to false, the default behaviour is that inter-DN communication will use the same QOP as client-DN connection.

property.name: dfs.encrypt.data.overwrite.downstream.new.qop
property.description: When dfs.datanode.overwrite.downstream.derived.qop is set to true, this configuration specifies the new QOP to be used to overwrite inter-DN QOP.

property.name: dfs.namenode.blockreport.queue.size
property.description: The queue size of BlockReportProcessingThread in BlockManager.

property.name: dfs.namenode.storage.dir.perm
property.description: Permissions for the directories on on the local filesystem where the DFS namenode stores the fsImage. The permissions can either be octal or symbolic.

property.name: dfs.namenode.blockreport.max.lock.hold.time
property.description: The BlockReportProcessingThread max write lock hold time in ms.

property.name: dfs.namenode.corrupt.block.delete.immediately.enabled
property.description: Whether the corrupt replicas should be deleted immediately, irrespective of other replicas on stale storages..

property.name: dfs.journalnode.edits.dir.perm
property.description: Permissions for the directories on on the local filesystem where the DFS journal node stores the edits. The permissions can either be octal or symbolic.

property.name: dfs.journalnode.handler.count
property.description: The number of JournalNode RPC server threads that listen to requests from clients.

property.name: dfs.namenode.lease-hard-limit-sec
property.description: Determines the namenode automatic lease recovery interval in seconds.

property.name: dfs.namenode.gc.time.monitor.enable
property.description: Enable the GcTimePercentage metrics in NameNode's JvmMetrics. It will start a thread(GcTimeMonitor) computing the metric.

property.name: dfs.namenode.gc.time.monitor.observation.window.ms
property.description: Determines the windows size of GcTimeMonitor. A window is a period of time starts at now-windowSize and ends at now. The GcTimePercentage is the gc time proportion of the window.

property.name: dfs.namenode.gc.time.monitor.sleep.interval.ms
property.description: Determines the sleep interval in the window. The GcTimeMonitor wakes up in the sleep interval periodically to compute the gc time proportion. The shorter the interval the preciser the GcTimePercentage. The sleep interval must be shorter than the window size.

property.name: dfs.permissions.allow.owner.set.quota
property.description: Whether the owner(not superuser) of a directory can set quota of his sub directories when permissions is enabled. Default value is false;

property.name: dfs.protected.subdirectories.enable
property.description: whether to protect the subdirectories of directories which set on fs.protected.directories.

property.name: dfs.storage.default.policy
property.description: Set the default Storage Policy name with following value, LAZY_PERSIST: memory storage policy. ALL_SSD : all SSD storage policy. ONE_SSD : one SSD_storage policy. HOT : hot storage policy. WARM : warm policy. COLD : cold_storage policy. PROVIDED : provided storage policy.

property.name: dfs.datanode.same-disk-tiering.enabled
property.description: HDFS-15548 to allow DISK/ARCHIVE to be configured on the same disk mount to manage disk IO. When this is enabled, datanode will control the capacity of DISK/ARCHIVE based on reserve-for-archive.percentage.

property.name: dfs.datanode.reserve-for-archive.default.percentage
property.description: Default disk capacity ratio of ARCHIVE volume, expected the value to be between 0 to 1. This will be applied when DISK/ARCHIVE volumes are configured on the same mount, which is detected by datanode. Beware that capacity usage might be >100% if there are already data blocks exist and the configured ratio is small, which will prevent the volume from taking new blocks until capacity is balanced out.

property.name: dfs.datanode.same-disk-tiering.capacity-ratio.percentage
property.description: Disk capacity ratio of DISK or ARCHIVE volume when dfs.datanode.same-disk-tiering is turned on This will override the value of dfs.datanode.reserve-for-archive.default.percentage . Example value: [0.3]/disk1/archive,[0.7]/disk1/disk,[0.4]/disk2/archive,[0.6]/disk2/disk This is only effective for configured DISK/ARCHIVE volumes in dfs.datanode.data.dir.

property.name: dfs.balancer.getBlocks.hot-time-interval
property.description: Balancer prefer moving cold blocks i.e blocks associated with files accessed or modified before the specified time interval.

property.name: dfs.datanode.directoryscan.max.notify.count
property.description: Defines the maximum number of blocks that the DirectoryScanner may notify namenode right way for received or deleted blocks after one round.

property.name: dfs.datanode.nameservices.resolution-enabled
property.description: Determines if the given nameservice address is a domain name which needs to be resolved (using the resolver configured by dfs.nameservices.resolver.impl). This is used by datanode to resolve namenodes.

property.name: dfs.datanode.nameservices.resolver.impl
property.description: Nameservice resolver implementation used by datanode. Effective with dfs.nameservices.resolution-enabled on.

property.name: dfs.client.mark.slownode.as.badnode.threshold
dfs.datanode.lockmanager.trace
property.description: If this is true, after shut down datanode lock Manager will print all leak thread that not release by lock Manager. Only used for test or trace dead lock problem. In produce default set false, because it's have little performance loss.

property.name: dfs.client.fsck.connect.timeout
property.description: The amount of time the fsck client will wait to connect to the namenode before timing out.

property.name: dfs.client.fsck.read.timeout
property.description: The amount of time the fsck client will wait to read from the namenode before timing out. If the namenode does not report progress more frequently than this time, the client will give up waiting.

property.name: dfs.client.output.stream.uniq.default.key
property.description: The default prefix key to construct the uniqKey for one DFSOutputStream. If the namespace is DEFAULT, it's best to change this conf to other value.

property.name: dfs.client.congestion.backoff.mean.time
property.description: The mean time in milliseconds which is used to compute client congestion backoff sleep time.

property.name: dfs.client.congestion.backoff.max.time
property.description: The max time in milliseconds which is used to restrict the upper limit backoff sleep time for client.

property.name: dfs.client.rbf.observer.read.enable
property.description: Enables observer reads for clients. This should only be enabled when clients are using routers.
